column4: erm.. ok.. how do I shoot the gnome resolution changer in the head and tell it REAL resolutions to use instead of it's crappy (WRONG) defaults?
this is the problem though: the XF86Config-4 file is correct now. 1440 x 900
gnome however, keeps setting the screen resolution to 1400x1050
so I miss the bottom 150 lines, which, just so happens to be the login screen options
Computer->System Config->Screen Resolution does not show the right resolution
if that doesn't show the right ones then you need to finish editing your config-4 file.
howso?
if your refresh rates aren't correct and all the differnt res. aren't put in for all the different modes then you will run into problems.
dpkg-reconfigure doesn't give you a chance to edit that value (just a pick list), and I can't see the value the screen resolution stuff is storing anywhere in the xfree config
hrm.. ok.. must be that it's not 60 Hz
I seen you mention a 1400X950 or something res.  Are you running wide screen monitor?
You may need to edit it by hand.
got it.. no modeline with that name.. will have to create one.. *sigh*
what kind of monitor do you have?
Toshiba Satellite P20 laptop
weird-ass 1440 x 900 display
Ok BRB I'm going to see what google digs up..  By chance are you dual booting?
yup
have you ever done an aida32 report?
if it annoys me, I'll just go bug daniels .. assuming he's at home today
nup.. any pointers?
